intro: Tina bongolavensis, commonly known as the Madagascar starflower, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a smooth surface and a slightly hairy underside. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Tina bongolavensis is considered a vulnerable species.
